newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigeria, Benin, Togo sign electric power accord.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria, Benin, Togo sign electric power accord.

text.p: Nigeria has signed an agreement to share electric power with the much smaller neighbouring West African states Benin and Togo, the ministry of power and steel said on Wednesday.
"The governments have agreed to build, maintain and operate the necessary equipments of an interconnection line." the agreement said.
"The (governments) agree to undertake exchange of electrical power according to the availability and needs of each of the states."
No specific mention was made of when any interconnection of generating or distribution networks would take place.

Nigeria in 1995 generated 14,483 million Kilowatt hours for its own consumption, but parts of the country are subject to frequent power cuts caused by both poor distribution and failure of gas supply to thermal power stations.
State-run Nigerian Electric Power Authority has been told it must be able to support itself on a commercial basis by the end of 1996, but the government has fallen short of outright privatisation.
